applications.updateAccountMsg: Please update system user account info

assets.ReplaceNodeAssetsAdminUser: Replace node assets admin user with this
assets.AdminUserListHelpMessage: Admin users are asset (charged server) on the root, or have NOPASSWD: ALL sudo permissions users, JumpServer users of the system using the user to `push system user`, `get assets hardware information`, etc.
assets.AssetListHelpMessage: The left side is the asset tree, right click to create, delete, and change the tree node, authorization asset is also organized as a node, and the right side is the asset under that node
assets.TestGatewayHelpMessage: If use nat, set the ssh real port
assets.CommandFilterHelpMessage: System user bound some command filter, each command filter has some rules, When user login asset with this system user, then run a command, The command will be filter by rules, higher priority rule run first, When a rule matched, if rule action is allow, then allow command execute, else if action is deny, then command with be deny, else match next rule, if none matched, allowed
assets.CommandFilterRulePriorityHelpText: 1-100, the higher will be match first
assets.AdDomainHelpText: AD domain provided to domain users for login
assets.SetAdDomainNoDisabled: If AD domain is set, it cannot be modified
assets.DomainHelpMessage:
The domain function is added to address the fact that some environments (such as the hybrid cloud) cannot be connected directly by jumping on the gateway server.
JMS => Domain gateway => Target assets
assets.GatewayProtocolHelpText: SSH protocol gateway, support proxy SSH, RDP, VNC
assets.Label: Label
assets.LoginModeHelpMessage: If you choose manual login mode, you do not need to fill in the username and password.
assets.Name: Name
assets.SwitchToUserListTips: When the following users are used to connect to assets, the current system user is used to log in and then switch.
assets.PriorityHelpMessage: 1-100, High level will be using login asset as default, if user was granted more than 2 system user
assets.PushAllSystemUsersToAsset: Push all system users to asset
assets.RemoteAppListHelpMessage: Before using this feature, make sure that the application loader has been uploaded to the application server and successfully published as a RemoteApp application Download application loader
assets.ReplaceNodeAssetsAdminUserWithThis: Replace node assets admin user with this
assets.SFTPHelpMessage: SFTP root dir, tmp, home or custom
assets.SudoHelpMessage: Use comma split multi command, ex: /bin/whoami, /bin/ifconfig
assets.SystemUserListHelpMessage:
System user is the account JumpServer used to log into the asset, such as using root `ssh root@host`, rather than the current user username（ssh admin@host)`;
Admin user is the account that already exists on an asset, and have privileged permissions, JumpServer using this create common system user, and gather hardware Etc;
Common user can pre-exist assets or created automatically by the admin user.
assets.UnselectedAssets: No asset selected or the selected asset does not support SSH protocol connection
assets.UsernameHelpMessage: Username is dynamic, When connect asset, using current user's username
assets.GroupsHelpMessage: Please fill in user groups, separated by commas if there are multiple user groups(Please fill in the existing user groups)

auth.LoginRequiredMsg: You account has logout, Please login again

eg: Every Sunday 03:05 run <5 3 * * 0>

helpText.esUrl: Tip: If you have multiple hosts, use comma (, ) to split (eg: http://www.jumpserver.a.com, http://www.jumpserver.b.com)
helpText.esIndex: Es provides the default index: jumpserver
helpText.esDocType: Es provides the default document type: command

setting.InsecureCommandNotifyToSubscription: Insecure command notification setting, change to system message subscription, support more notify method
setting.IdpMetadataHelpText: Choose one of IDP metadata URL and IDP metadata XML parameters. IDP metadata URL has high priority
setting.IdpMetadataUrlHelpText: Load IDP Metadata from remote url
setting.authSAMLKeyHelpText: SP cert and private key, using communicate with IDP
setting.authSAMLCertHelpText: After upload cert and private key, View SP Metadata

helpText.TempPassword: For a while, there is a period of 300 seconds, and there is a period of reuse.
helpText.ApiKeyList: The API key is used to sign the request header. The header of each request is different. Please refer to the usage documentation
helpText.authLdapUserAttrMap: User attr map present how to map LDAP user attr to jumpserver, username, name, email is jumpserver attr
helpText.emailCustomUserCreatedBody: Tips:When creating a user, send the content of the email
helpText.emailCustomUserCreatedHonorific: Tips: When creating a user, send the honorific of the email (eg:Hello)
helpText.emailCustomUserCreatedSubject: Tips: When creating a user, send the subject of the email (eg:Create account successfully)
helpText.emailEmailFrom: Tips: Send mail account, default SMTP account as the send account
helpText.emailHostPassword: Tips: Some provider use token except password
helpText.emailRecipient: Tips: Used only as a test mail recipient
helpText.emailSubjectPrefix: Tips: Some word will be intercept by mail provider
helpText.securityLoginLimitTime: Tip: (unit/minute) if the user has failed to log in for a limited number of times, no login is allowed during this time interval.
helpText.securityMaxIdleTime: If idle time more than it, disconnect connection Unit: minute
helpText.securityPasswordExpirationTime: Tip: (unit: day) If the user does not update the password during the time, the user password will expire failure;The password expiration reminder mail will be automatic sent to the user by system within 5 days (daily) before the password expires
helpText.terminalSessionKeepDuration: Units: days, Session, record, command will be delete if more than duration, only in database
helpText.userGuideUrl: User first login update profile done redirect to it

helpTip.emailUserSSL: If SMTP port is 465, may be select
helpTip.emailUserTLS: If SMTP port is 587, may be select
helpTip.securityMfaAuth: After opening, all user login must use MFA(valid for all users, including administrators)
helpTip.securityPasswordLowerCase: After opening, the user password changes and resets must contain lowercase letters
helpTip.securityPasswordNumber: After opening, the user password changes and resets must contain numeric characters
helpTip.securityPasswordSpecialChar: After opening, the user password changes and resets must contain special characters
helpTip.securityPasswordUpperCase: After opening, the user password changes and resets must contain uppercase letters
helpTip.securityServiceAccountRegistration: Allow using bootstrap token register service account, when terminal setup, can disable it

users.DescribeOfGuide: Welcome to JumpServer. Click here for more information

HelpText.MFAOfUserFirstLoginPersonalInformationIm:
Enable multi-factor authentication to make the account more secure
After is enabled, you will enter the multi-factor authentication binding process on your next login
You can also bind directly in (personal information -> fast modifier -> modifier multiple factor Settings)
HelpText.MFAOfUserFirstLoginUserGuidePage:
To protect the security of you and the company
please properly keep your account, password, key and other important and sensitive information
(e.g., set a complex password and enable multi-factor authentication)
HelpText.OrgRoleHelpText: Organizational roles are the user's role in the current organization
HelpText.addRolePermissions: After add or update success, set permissions in detail page

HelpText.CrontabOfCreateUpdatePage:
For example: every Sunday at 03:05 execute <5 3 * * 0>
Using the 5-bit Linux crontab expression ( Online tool )
If both regularly perform and cycle perform execution are set, use regularly perform first
HelpText.UsernameOfCreateUpdatePage: The username of the user on the target host; If already existed, modify user password; If it doesn't exist, add the user and set the password.

Cloud.IsAlwaysUpdateHelpTips: Whether the asset information, including Hostname, IP, Platform, and AdminUser, is updated synchronously each time a synchronization task is performed
